top_reviews.review: This was simply great. There are higher building around, but open air atmosphere makes it really special. Short queue in the morning, free of charge and impressive experience make it worth visiting for sure.

top_reviews.title: Great city views from the tower
top_reviews.review: A really great opportunity to see the London skyline in 360 degrees. The queue wasn't too lengthy , 10 minutes at most. The security search was efficient and staff friendly. The garden was well maintained with gardeners at work when we were there. Being Feb the seasonality meant that little colour was apparent. The views were good throughout the viewing glass. It would be useful to have a NESW map and list what can be seen on the horizon. Thanks for the opportunity to view without any cost which is appreciated in a city which is expensive for all families

top_reviews.title: Worth a visit.
top_reviews.review: We were going to go to Sky garden, but it required booking so went here instead. There was a queue upon arriving, but it moved quickly. Staff were very friendly. Once in the garden, it was very relaxing with lovely views. We ate at the restaurant - I forget it's name - which was lovely, but pricey.

top_reviews.title: Amazing views
top_reviews.review: Another day well spent and it was FREE! Well worth visiting, experience for everyone. Couldn’t believe how quickly i got from bottom to top of this incredible building. Less than 5 minutes. I was lucky the queue was little, I suggest getting there early. Opens at 10 I got there about 10mins before opening time. You get searched at bottom, then take short lift ride to top floor (15) To discover amazing views of London, including Shard, Gerkin, Bridge and so much more! Toilets are on floor 14 if needed. Also restaurant and bar

name: Greenwich
description: Set on the south bank of the Thames, approximately five miles from central London, this city borough is rich in maritime history and features the Old Royal Naval College, National Maritime Museum and the Royal Observatory, which was built by Sir Christopher Wren for King Charles II.

top_reviews.title: Greenwich a must see all day event
top_reviews.review: Greenwich is a beautiful town outside of London. It was my first time there (been to London more than a dozen times) and it did not disappoint. If you are into sailing or anything Maritime it is well worth the trip. The best way to get there is by Uber boat, but please remember to check in and off the boat or you will be charge for the entire route. The Cutty Sark, National Maritime Museum, Queen's House and other attractions are all within walking distance. I would recommend not booking anything in advance, because if it rains it will be a miserable trip. We had a gorgeous day, plan to take the entire day so you can grab lunch in town and visit the sites which in most cases are free to the public.

top_reviews.title: A great day out!
top_reviews.review: What a fantastic way to spend the day! A beautiful Georgian town with lots of interesting things to check out. Definitely worth having a stroll around and going to the museums. Every place we went was very welcoming and informative. Be prepared to do a lot of walking, the tired feet at the end of the day are worth it!

top_reviews.title: A wonderful and fun day out
top_reviews.review: We took advantage of a Real Socializing coach tour to Greenwich. It was a smart thing to do given the traffic density. What a day out! Part of the cost of the tour covered a guide assisted exploration of how the classical buildings of the Old Royal Naval College have been used, in particular for movies. This was a fun and informative experience. There’s so much to see and do in Greenwich. We chose to walk by theThames, which gave us spectacular views of the Cutty Sark. We also walked up to the Royal Observatory. Pie and mash had been recommended to us for lunch. We complied and were glad we did. Overall, a tiring but wonderful experience, made that much easier by not having to drive home

top_reviews.title: Brilliant day out
top_reviews.review: This is a fantastic full day and I mean full day out for the family. There is so much to do here and most of it is free. You have to pay for the Observatory but that is well worth it. The museum is free and is a really good museum. The pavilion Caffe at the top of the grounds is well worth a visit for lunch . We got the boat bus from West Minister to Greenwich and the views were amazing. Highly recommended

top_reviews.title: A very warm welcome.
top_reviews.review: Greeted with warmth and humour by the lovely Nicolai. He was very pleasant and my sister’s husband had stayed the week before and advised us to ask for floors 4,5 and 6 after a recent refurbishment. Not to be disappointed we were treated to these and they were off excellent upgrade. We had additional queries and he answered very professionally and with patience and care. He then served us at the bar to. A very professional approach to us and any given situation. A credit to you as an employer of him and how he managed himself. He made a great first impression to us all.

top_reviews.title: Worth a visit
top_reviews.review: Greenwich is such a lovely part of London. Great photos of old maritime buildings set in front of the skyscrapers of the city. Lovely market and tonnes of little independent cafes and pubs. The park and observatory are great to visit.

top_reviews.title: Amazing place to go
top_reviews.review: Amazing place to go. Just walk around and you will find lots of amazing parts. Observatory, huge park, museum, tunnel you can walk under Thames. If you hungry you can find lots restaurants around too. Worth to visit

top_reviews.title: Quaintness and History
top_reviews.review: This historic part of London is a delight to explore. From the moment you step off of the DLR line, this area captivates an invigorating spirit. Walking the streets on our way to Greenwich Park and the Royal Observatory, we were captivated by the mix of old and new.

top_reviews.title: A London Treat!
top_reviews.review: I have been to Greenwich 4 times now and still believe that I have not seen everything. It really is such a historic. relaxed and safe place to visit; certainly one of London's highlights. Stand on the Meridian Line at the Royal Observatory, experience life on board Cutty Sark, the world’s last remaining tea clipper, see the fabulous baroque artistry of the Painted Hall at the Old Royal Naval College, explore Britain’s naval history at the National Maritime Museum, shop the fabulous designer-maker arts & crafts in historic Greenwich Market etc. You can actually see a great deal for free, like the National Maritime Museum or enjoy the park. You can also walk around many buildings and treasures like the Cutty Sark or go shopping in the market or take up food and drink in the many places on offer. The best way to arrive is by boat to the pier as you get to see the river and the waterfront from a unique perspective. These trips are easly booked and in the main leave from Westminster Pier.

top_reviews.title: Thriving Town
top_reviews.review: Our cruise ship docked here and we did not have enough time to go into London, so we explored this thriving town. Best things to do include the terrific market to eat and buy stuff, and the Painted Hall at the Naval College. Very busy high street area.

name: Hyde Park
description: Once the hunting ground for Henry VIII, this large royal park is best known for its famous Speakers' Corner, where people speak their minds, Rotton Row, a famous horse-riding area and Serpentine Lake, home to waterfowl and oarsmen.

top_reviews.title: Tranquil Oasis in London
top_reviews.review: Hyde Park is a serene escape in the heart of London. Whether you're strolling by the lake, picnicking on the lush lawns, or simply enjoying the natural beauty, it offers a peaceful retreat from the city's hustle and bustle. A must-visit for a moment of tranquility.

top_reviews.title: Sunday lunchtime beside the Serpentine
top_reviews.review: A gentle bright warm late October walk in the park to recover from the previous evening’s disappointment as England crashed out in the RWC semifinal. Very restful despite the numbers doing the same. Particularly interested to see the impressive Simon Gudgeon sculpture of the ibis beside the lake.

top_reviews.title: Beautiful!
top_reviews.review: As luck would have it the British weather decided to be sunny for our visit on Sunday. We stopped in the café on our way in for lunch - plenty of choice even for me as a vegetarian, and the food was lovely. Plenty of benches and seating outside, our only one gripe would be that my partner asked where the toilet was (it's outside at the back down some stone steps), and was told rather curtly that it was customers only - it wasn't like he wasn't stood next to me as I paid! We walked over to Kensington, so walked the length of the park - stopping in the gift shop on our way up where staff were friendly. Grounds were well kept and maintained.

top_reviews.title: London's stunning Hyde Park
top_reviews.review: What can I say about London's Hyde Park. It's stunning! For me, this one of the top places to visit on your London trip. It's perfect in the summer, but suitable for all times of the year. Enjoy a nice walk, or take a bike ride around the park. Take a little walk down via the lake and grab a coffee (or whatever you want) from the cafe by the lake and take in the amazing views and sights that Hyde Park has to offer. In the summer time on a sunny day, it's perfect, other times you will find events, such as concerts and a perfect example of this time of year (November / December) is Winter Wonderland. An amazing event. Since I have been living in London, I've lost track of the times I have come for a nice morning walk at least twice a week. I can't recommend this enough.

top_reviews.title: Impressive open space in Europes Busiest and biggest city
top_reviews.review: If you are looking for a quiet place to relax in London's city centre, then come to this park. Yes there are many people here generally, however between the trees tends to pretty (and) quiet. it incredible that in Europe's biggest and busiest city, lies such a large open area, Highly recommended. Officially, you are not allowed to ride bicycles here, but considering the enormous underinvestment for cyclist infrastucture, on London's streets, I break this rule and do cycle as this is the only place cyclists can travel long distances without vehicular traffic.

top_reviews.title: Safe, beautiful inner-city park.
top_reviews.review: We stayed near Hyde Park and walked through int several times during our weeklong visit. Loved the swans, the gift shop (has Britain based handcrafts) ,the cleanliness, the feeling of safety. Lots of people strolling all day. Well lit; with attentive staff.

top_reviews.title: A lively and beautiful oasis
top_reviews.review: Hyde Park is a beautiful and spacious oasis in the heart of London. Whether you're looking for a peaceful stroll, a lively picnic, or a fun day out, Hyde Park has something for everyone. It's the perfect place to take in the sights and sounds of the city while enjoying some fresh air. Highly recommended!

top_reviews.title: Afternoon stroll
top_reviews.review: Decided to explore the whole of Hyde Park and 6 miles later was exhausted (door to door!). Thought it was great and loved the walk seeing lots of statues and landmarks with Kensington Palace being the turning point. If you go to London spend time here if and if you are fit enough walk round it all. 👍

top_reviews.title: Fabulous!
top_reviews.review: Hyde Park Hyde is central London's largest green space and covers 350 acres. There are no hills, and plenty of paths and well-signaled walkways and maps. Walking the perimeter takes about 90 minutes, and it's so vast that there are plenty of spots to set down and take a break. Don´t miss Speakers `Corner!

top_reviews.title: Park
top_reviews.review: We had a walk through Hyde Park actually just by chance - we were actually looking for some public toilets (which we found). Walking through the park we saw loads of people on roller skates dancing to music and having a great time, including a man dressed as superman. We had a nice time and a relaxed walk through the park.

name: Buckingham Palace
description: Buckingham Palace is recognised around the world as the focus of national and royal celebrations as well as the backdrop to the regular Changing the Guard ceremony. Explore the magnificent State Rooms which are open to visitors for 10 weeks each summer and on selected dates during winter and spring. During a visit to Buckingham Palace, visitors can see the 19 magnificent State Rooms, which provide the setting for ceremonial occasions and official entertaining. All rooms are furnished with many of the greatest treasures from the Royal Collection.
category: Historic Sites Points of Interest & Landmarks
address: Spur Road, London SW1A 1AA England

top_reviews.title: An absolute treasure
top_reviews.review: So worth going in the summer to see the inside of the Palace! I have been to London before but I timed it this time to see the inside of Buckingham Palace. I am a royal fan so this was great and we got to enjoy viewing some pieces and information from the recent coronation. I got the tickets through the website for about 2pm. It was busy but manageable at that time. Not crazy crowded. My teens actually loved it too! I highly recommend. Dessert at the cafe was absolutely delicious I wish I could fly back to sit in the patio and eat it again! I even posted a picture for you to try it lol. Even the bathroom was great it looks like a shack but there is a soap in there that has an amazing smell but they dont sell it in the gift shop? Give yourself enough time to enjoy the walk out too (to the exit). The gardens and willow trees and lake you pass are just beautiful as well! You will end up walking slow to take it in.

top_reviews.title: Good tour
top_reviews.review: We did a combo bus tour of Windsor Castle and Buckingham Palace. When we visited many years ago, we did not get to see the interior of the Palace. The Palace is very beautiful inside and out, especially the area surrounding the Palace. There is a nice park and another open area with a large fountain. The interior is very nice, just as I imagined, it with beautiful furnishings and loads of artwork. So happy that we had an opportunity to see the interior this time.

top_reviews.title: Great tour
top_reviews.review: This is a must-see while in London! I don't care about the royal family and I was still impressed by the tour of the state rooms. My mother cares a lot and she was so excited to see the places shown in photos and on TV. We did the "royal day out" which includes the Queen's Gallery and the Royal Mews. They were interesting but the Palace is definitely the highlight - if you are short on time, you're not missing much in the other 2. A headset with audio guide in several languages is provided. You end in the garden where there is a cafe and of course an extensive gift shop. No photos are allowed inside the Palace. Double check the schedule as the Palace is only open certain times of the year and certain days of the week.

top_reviews.title: Excellent
top_reviews.review: We booked the tour of the Palace, including the new exhibition of the King and Queen's Coronation robes. The tour of the Palace is fascinating, with all the grandeur of the State rooms. The tour ends on the steps of the back lawn, where there is a substantial cafe and shop. Prices here are a bit steep. The exit leads you through the lovely Palace Gardens back on to a side road. No photography allowed inside the Palace and this is strictly enforced.

top_reviews.title: Bucking ham Palace with all its glory
top_reviews.review: London and all its pomp and circumstance on display is mesmerizing! The 45 min changing of the guard is an experience in and of itself. The gold gates and and the formalities remind us whose United a kingdom it real is! God save the King!

top_reviews.title: Wonderful Experience
top_reviews.review: Obtained a ticket to the Royal Collection Trust visit to Buckingham Palace guided tour. This was definitely something I’d always wanted to do and it did not disappoint. Our guide was I believe Charlotte who took us through the magnificent state rooms of the palace. We were able to stand in the throne rooms as well as reception halls. The rooms were decorated for Christmas which enhanced the experience. Additional aides Trevor and Mandy assisted in the experience. Also I commend the officer at the door to the Queens Gallery as being the most helpful person ever. I thought I had misplaced my ticket and he put me most as ease. Kudos to the staff at Buckingham Palace. They appear to love their positions. We also received at complimentary guide book at the end of our visit. Sorry. Pictures not allowed. You must book.

top_reviews.title: Get there early before the crowds
top_reviews.review: We’re not what you would call Royalists by any stretch but had to see it to tick off the list. Beautiful day and key tip is go for your early morning walk before coffee and get there early. We were prob there around 7am and no one there which caught us by surprise so had a good nosy through the gates. When we came back by after a few hrs the place was packed!

top_reviews.title: Take the Tour!
top_reviews.review: After multiple trips to London and always walking by Buckingham Palace we finally booked a tour and it exceeded my highest expectations. Mandy, our tour guide, led us through 8 beautiful public rooms and in each room she brought out the history that made the room come alive. I highly recommend it.

top_reviews.title: worth a visit
top_reviews.review: Buckingham Palace, one of Britain’s most iconic buildings is the official residence of King Charles III. It offers a historic art collection, beautiful gardens and perhaps the most majestic staircase in the world. Very interesting!

top_reviews.title: A stunning experience!
top_reviews.review: An amazing 90 minute tour round the State Rooms of the Palace. Our guide was superb and all the staff are polite, friendly, well informed and efficient. The Palace is magnificent and the art on display is beautiful. It was fascinating to see behind the façade.

name: Big Ben
description: Better known as Big Ben (it's actually the name of the Great Bell!), this iconic clock tower which stands at the Houses of Parliament is officially called the Elizabeth Tower, named in honor of Queen Elizabeth II's Diamond Jubilee. When the Elizabeth Tower is open for tours, you can climb up the tower and admire the clock and bell up close. But fret not, you can still learn about its history and admire its ornate golden facade on a tour of London or the Houses of Parliament.
address: Parliament Square Elizabeth Tower - Houses of Parliament, Westminster, London SW1A 0AA England

top_reviews.title: Big Ben
top_reviews.review: We were among the thousands of people that stood near Big Ben in August of 2017 to hear the last chimes before Big Ben was shut down for almost five years! How wonderful to see the amazing restoration and see the tower gleaming and chiming again! History lives on!

top_reviews.title: Timeless Majesty
top_reviews.review: Big Ben is an absolute legend in London! Every time that clock chimes, it's like the whole city comes to life. And let me tell you, that building looks absolutely epic. If you're ever in London, you gotta check out Big Ben for yourself. It's one of those things you just gotta see to believe!

top_reviews.title: The Icon that I was most excited to see.
top_reviews.review: Big Ben was the number 1 site I was looking forward to seeing on our first trip to London. We managed to walk over Westminster Bridge both at night and during the day, so I got all of the pictures I was hoping to get. I know it was recently restored and it looks amazing!

top_reviews.title: Big Ben is London
top_reviews.review: Laying eyes on Big Ben meant seeing London for real to keep. It is located near the London Eye and Westminster Abbey! Great experience for my first time in London!

top_reviews.title: Big Ben is named after Benjamin Hall, the First Commissioner for Works
top_reviews.review: Big Ben was on my way to Westminster Abbey so I killed two birds with one stone. I got here early, so there was no jostling for space and room to take photos. It was quiet and calm, sadly, also dreary and drizzly but it's London! You expect rain!

top_reviews.title: Ben-sational!!! 🔔 🔔 🔔 🔔 🔔
top_reviews.review: Big Ben Tour Dec 2023. Was able to book tickets to climb up the iconic Elizabeth Tower. Currently they are only available for UK residents and are on sale every second Wednesday at 10am. They sell out quicker than the old bell chimes! What an incredible tour. We climbed the 334 steps up to the belfry, saw Big Ben II bell struck 12 times at noon, saw the clock mechanism before walking behind all 4 clock faces. As a proud Brit - this is much more than a clock - it’s a national symbol that has been the background for so many historical events and the traditional New Year celebrations. It was an absolute privilege to be there and surprisingly emotional. The tour is fully guided with lots of stops, where you are provided with pertinent information. The only criticism/frustration was the fact that no photos are allowed. They were very strict on this and cameras/phones had to be put in a locker. It would’ve been fantastic to capture a magical tour. Not sure what the reason for this is - security or timing? Bought a guide book in the Westminster shop though.

top_reviews.title: Classic landmark
top_reviews.review: Hotta visit Big Ben when in London. Quite a cool symbol of the UK but not a real destination for tourists except from the outside. Listen to it ring snd you ate good to go.

top_reviews.title: Looks great
top_reviews.review: Beautiful clock, aka Elizabeth Tower, on the Thames River. Stand on the bridge for best lighting for photos before noon....was lucky to have blue sky in my pictures! It's been restored and looks so much better and cleaner than last time I saw it. Iconic English landmark you just have to see!

top_reviews.title: A picture might say a lot, but it has to be seen live
top_reviews.review: So beautiful in real life. A picture might say a lot, but it has to be seen live. And on the other hand one can’t help taking several photos when seeing it. As a bonus we noticed a playful seal swimming by in the river Thames as we were taking pictures from the bridge.

top_reviews.title: Iconic Big Ben - not just a pretty face.
top_reviews.review: Big Ben is an iconic landmark and a testament to the well-designed architecture. More importantly, it plays an essential role in British history. It’s amazing that it’s been well maintained. I especially like the clock face and when the bell tolls. This is not just a clock to tell time but an important reminder of British history and of that era.

top_reviews.title: Great open space with plenty to do around the area
top_reviews.review: Lovely little park with plenty space for all to enjoy. Loads of horse chestnut trees so currently dropping their conkers so great for kids to go find the biggest one. Walked though to get to the observatory and then came back via the queens house. Which has a play area for kids too

top_reviews.title: Beautiful place
top_reviews.review: Very beautiful place a lot to do and walk with dog ! Very nice caffe and flower garden ! At the moment it’s a lot ground work going on and a little bit ruined our experience ( but I understand it’s have to be done ) I hope next time we will enjoy 100 % !

top_reviews.title: Amazing park
top_reviews.review: We visited here with friends on a sunny Good Friday. We had a nice walk round the park to the viewpoint and then to the kids play area. The play area was really good, with a sandpit and lots of fun slides. We walked a bit further and found ourselves in the flower gardens, these fields were lovely and in immaculate condition. We had a lovely time playing here

top_reviews.title: Blackheath and the southern part of Greenwich Park are often forgotten by travellers
top_reviews.review: If you don't have a dog be sure to visit the Flower Garden at the southern end of the park. You can reach it from Blackheath, itself a wild windy plateau with space and wildflowers galore...I thought of a lady from the past requiring her maid to fetch her fresh Lady's Bedstraw from the heath, where it grows in profusion with delicate light yellow flowers. There is a new cafe and toilets just outside the Flower Garden's eastern entrance, handy to know about.

name: London Underground
description: London Underground, better known as the Tube, has 11 lines covering 402km and serving 270 stations. Opened in 1863, it is the world's oldest underground railway network, and one of the largest.

top_reviews.title: A mixture of old and new
top_reviews.review: The network is extensive and convenient to use. Visitors who have a contactless credit/debit card need not worry about how to buy a ticket. The card can be used to pay and get through the gates. With a daily cap of £8.2 (zone 1 and2), the fares can still be considered reasonable. The new lines ( say QE line) and upgraded stations are very modern. On the other hand, there are still lines (say Piccadilly) and many stations awaiting improvements. For many lines, once underground, the smartphone can no longer receive data. I hope I am wrong, but it appears that many stations are still not wheelchair accessible. This is quite unacceptable for an international city as London.

top_reviews.title: Wish every city had a metro like London
top_reviews.review: There is nothing I have experienced like the London Underground. It is so efficient and covers so much area. Two times in a row I have had a connection in London where a flight got cancelled. I was able to use the tube to get into London for a few hours of shopping and eating during the extended layover. So easy and inexpensive. And you don't even have to buy tickets or cards or whatever. Just scan your credit card (if chipped) and you are set. If you are in London and haven't tried it, you should. No better way to get around.

top_reviews.title: Cars run constantly
top_reviews.review: They have people stationed by the entrance,so we just asked each time what train to take, much easier. Lots of routes and transfers. Recommend getting an oyster card, we ordered ours in advance of the time worked great.

top_reviews.title: It's a lundun thing
top_reviews.review: Love the underground system in london it's so easy to use. And if u struggle with something or don't know if it's the right train, u can always just ask the next person and that person will tell you. People in london are very nice and helpful! And the staff is often very nice Luke forexample some stations don't have an elevator and I vas traveling solo with my luggage and was struggling í was always offered a hand even tho one of the staff was having serious back problems he still helped me with my luggage up the stairs that was so sweet. And u never really have to wait long for a train Big shoutout to london underground system I recommend getting the oyster card

top_reviews.title: Extremely easy to understand and very clean.
top_reviews.review: we used the Underground three times on our long weekend trip to Central London. One trip to King's Cross from Leicester Square and then back. Once from Aldgate East to Embankment. The Aldgate trip was after a Jack the Ripper Tour and the Tube was not busy at all. Plenty of available seats (a Monday Night). The King's Cross trip was busy on the way there and extremely busy on the way back. The American Football Game that was playing that weekend had just ended and there were people everywhere. Still, everyone was polite and it worked great. Get your Oyster Card in advance if you are a tourist. We had ours mailed to us in the States. They never expire, so we cane use them again on a future trip.

top_reviews.title: Mind Blowing
top_reviews.review: It still blows my mind how you can get anywhere at anytime and everything runs like clockwork. Never a delay, and a train every couple of minutes. One of the best public transports I’ve ever seen.

top_reviews.title: A very impressive transportation system.
top_reviews.review: It is a little overwhelming and confusing at first because the system is so vast. Once you get focused on the line you want or need to use, you can get anywhere and see almost every main attraction for little cost. A very impressive system.

top_reviews.title: Great way to travel
top_reviews.review: We used the underground extensively whilst staying in London. Probably frequented most stations in central London over the 4 days we were there! The service was good, usually on time. Only issues were on some lines the trains were old and they were uncomfortably noisy. Also on occasion it was extremely busy and there was a lot of pushing and shoving. We used out debit cards to travel so it was easy. Journeys are priced individually depending on what zone you are in and there are also daily and weekly caps. We hit our daily cap most days we were there and that capped the cost at £8.10. Children under 11 travel free with a paying adult - just tap your card and both of you go through the disabled / pushchair gate.

top_reviews.title: Good quick service
top_reviews.review: If you want to get around London I’d recommend the tube. Download the ap for quick and easy ways to get around. Very convenient to use. You can also download step free guide which shows you the stations to use with a buggy/wheelchair

top_reviews.title: Every Credit
top_reviews.review: I have been on the Underground countless times when visiting the Capital but thought it was time to give credit. A great system that gets you around London and always friendly staff. Easy to navigate and now with paying with your phone you don’t have the issue of queuing for your ticket. At least London have done this right well done.

name: Borough Market
description: This market is one of London’s oldest and largest food markets, with over 100 delicatessens, butchers, fishmongers, and cheesemakers selling fresh produce, meats, artisanal delicacies, and more. It's where locals come to do their grocery runs, and where travelers can come to try some of the best British food in a historic setting. Join a food and market tour of London to make sure you don't miss any of the best stalls. It gets busy on weekend afternoons, and some traders aren't open on all days—typically on limited market days early in the week—so be sure to plan ahead. – Tripadvisor
address: 8 Southwark Street, London SE1 1TL England

top_reviews.title: The best food market in the world!
top_reviews.review: This place was on my bucket list! Borough market. I really love this place! The atmosphere is great, the food is so good. This market is the delicatesse of London. The vendors are nice and you can taste so much quality food! Next time I will be there again!

top_reviews.title: My new favourite place
top_reviews.review: There are honestly not enough words to describe how much I loved this place. If you enjoy food it is a must visit. Delicious food at every turn, friendly traders and amazing variety. Could have spent a full day here. Just GO!!!

top_reviews.title: Plenty of choice
top_reviews.review: We didn't buy anything being tourists, but we did come for a look around and wow! You certainly are spoiled for choice here, plenty of spices, wines & alcohol, cheese, meat and vegetable stands. It's a shame we are not local, as this would defiantly be somewhere we'd come and shop, as you couldn't find some of these things in your average shop. One of the spice shops took our fancy - having everything you could possibly have, if we're back in London soon, we will have to look at recipies we want to cook to make use of this market more thoroughly.

top_reviews.title: Unbelievable Choices
top_reviews.review: What a market! Worth a visit even if it is just a walk through. There are so many choices. Food galore. Be prepared for the crowds. It can be difficult to walk through and try to take in because there are wall to wall people. Wish we had more time to take it in but we were trying to cram a lot in to a short visit. The most popular food choices had very long lines. Go if you have a chance be prepared to be overwhelmed!

top_reviews.title: Great- but stupidly busy at weekends
top_reviews.review: I’ve been coming for years here to buy some great food and eat from the stalls. I don’t live in London so always head here when around. However, not any more! I went today and it was ridiculously busy with tourists pushing and shoving in queues to get things. I think the weekends are to be avoided here in future. It takes the fun out of it when it is like that.

top_reviews.title: Amazing Market, Avoid at Weekend and School Holidays!
top_reviews.review: Amazing Market with many Market stalls that sell all kinds of things from Huge steaks and Fresh Seafood to Amazing family owned bakeries and Indian street food. I can guarantee that you will find most types of food in this market. There are lots of family owned businesses and they are all excellent at selling there products by calling you over and giving you offers on food. Even though it’s a big space it was packed and some of the queues were crazy to got simple things like coffee or pastries. Definitely avoid on weekends and school holidays as there are loads of tourists as well as regular customers at the market which makes it extremely busy. The shops are very busy so the shopkeepers don’t have much time to chat and unlike other London markets the stalls don’t offer you and samples of the food their stall sells. Definitely coming back!

top_reviews.title: Bustling and vibrant
top_reviews.review: Plenty of options to check out here! I love the meat pies at Pieminister. You can also get fresh fruits and vegetables, gourmet cheeses, specialty meats, and delicious street food. Prepare yourself for the crowds - but it’s worth it in my opinion!

top_reviews.title: Go on a weekday for some reprieve of people, but not much!
top_reviews.review: This place is CROWDED even on a weekday, so I can imagine on a weekend it's even crazier! It was a good place to get out of the rain. If I had to recommend one stall to try, make it Joli and get the beef rendang. It is DELICIOUS! We also tried Portena's empanadas and I loved those too.

top_reviews.title: An amazing market for foodies
top_reviews.review: An excellent place for foodies especially for seafood, cheese and mushroom lovers. We been there on a Tuesday morning and luckily it was not too busy. Easy to reach by public transportation, just a few steps away from the London Bridge metro station.

top_reviews.title: Enjoy the buzz
top_reviews.review: First time visiting Borough Market and I loved the buzz. We had delicious tacos from Tacos Padre, then shared an amazing pork sandwich from The Black Pig and to finish we had an amazing crumble from Humble Crumble. Yes it is expensive, yes you have to queue and yes it is really busy but all worth it to have a taste of some fresh and delicious food. Just go with the right frame of mind and enjoy the buzz.

name: F1 Arcade
description: F1 Arcade brings all the excitement and glamour of Formula 1® to London. With 60 full motion racing simulators, incredible food and a crafted cocktail menu, this is social gaming.
address: 1 New Change, London EC4M 9AF England

top_reviews.title: Fun experience!
top_reviews.review: The vibe, service, location and the game were so much fun and great! Big shout out to Joshua, the staff member that went the extra mile to look after us throughout our stay. Making sure we understand the mechanics of the game while efficiently serving our drinks! Will definitely come back! :)

top_reviews.title: For an f1 fan it’s a must!!
top_reviews.review: Went to the f1 arcade for a watch party. And what an experience, I went with my son who is 21 so went grandstand tickets. The staff are lovely and was catering to our every needs, the sim racing was amazing. I will definitely go back for another watch party before the end of the season.

top_reviews.title: Great venue for the city F1 fans!
top_reviews.review: Would have been a 5 if the price of a large glass of Pinot Grigio wasn’t £19! The venue is stunning the Sim Rigs are easy to use and realistic user level let you get used to it and be competitive. Reception staff are fantastic and explained everything really well. Tip! Make sure you create user profiles on the web site before you go this saves a fair bit of time at the racing machines. Then it’s just a scan of a QR code and off you go! Will be back next week in the evening to have more races, nice job, good luck!

top_reviews.title: Amazing experience
top_reviews.review: Overall the experience is amazing, if you haven’t driven in the past a simulator is extra exciting 😁😁. You can get your drinks and watch other people driving or try it yourself. The only negative thing that I have to say is that nobody explained us things like for the pointing system or other stuff since it was our first time in the place. We managed to log in and play ourselves but we left and we still don’t know what are the points for 😂😂

top_reviews.title: A must do experience
top_reviews.review: Really great immersive experience that is fun for all abilities. The price for the experience is really good, even on a weekend when it is more expensive the value is still worth it. The only downside would be that the cost of food and drink is a little too expensive

top_reviews.title: Great family experience
top_reviews.review: We visited with our children (aged 9 & 12) on a Sunday afternoon, we were lucky enough to be able to book on arrival - the children weren’t overly keen on having a go on the simulators but did in the end and absolutely loved it! The ambience is great and chips were yummy. Overall, a fab experience and will definitely be visiting again

top_reviews.title: Track limits? Never heard of her.
top_reviews.review: A must do for F1 fans in London / while visiting. The racing prices are reasonable, especially for London. Same with food pricing and it was delicious. Drinks a bit costly but there is bound to be one thing a bit more ott expensive for F1 / London! The staff were fantastic and explained everything clearly. Even got a surprise happy birthday sang to my partner when I mentioned it was his 40th as a casual comment. Was not expecting that or the birthday brownie at all. Just a whole lot of fun. I mean aside from max verstappen wiping me out of first place at the end of one of the simulation races, but seeing as I wasn't penalised for exceeding track limits I shouldn't complain!

top_reviews.title: Great time was had by all
top_reviews.review: A great experience in a lovely venue & not overly priced. We had a part of six which was randomly selected into teams. The food that came out was hot & extremely good. The racing was really good fun with the whole group enjoying it . Our age range was 34 to 75

top_reviews.title: Good for F1 fans
top_reviews.review: Was nice to visit, food and drink where decent and a great atmosphere to watch the qualifying that was going on before our race simulation. This was ok nothing amazing! Lacked some things! Not being able to pick your own car or tracks wasn’t what I was expecting! Worth a visit but don’t make a special trip!

top_reviews.title: Good experience!
top_reviews.review: We purchased 3 head-to-head races and found this was enough for me and my partner. The racing simulators were a lot of fun, my only comment is that I would’ve liked to see a member of staff cleaning the simulators after each party. The whole vibe was immaculate, and the theming was incredible. Staff were really friendly and helpful. We didn’t order food however did stop for drinks and did think they were overpriced for what it was but it is London. Overall 8.5/10 and would recommend.

name: Bomber Command Memorial
description: The RAF Benevolent Fund is proud and privileged to be the custodian of the new Bomber Command Memorial in central London. The memorial has been built to be modern, yet classical, in Portland stone. At its heart are the bronze sculptures of a Bomber Command aircrew. Within the memorial, the space is open to the sky with an opening designed to allow light to fall directly onto sculptures of the aircrew.
address: Hyde Park Green Park, London W2 2UH England

name: Craven Cottage
description: Visit Craven Cottage, the iconic home of Fulham Football Club, London's oldest professional football club. Walk in the footsteps of some of the greatest players to ever play the game; marvel at the 1905 Pavilion, designed by the legendary Archibald Leitch and try a seat in the Johnny Haynes Stand, named after the clubs greatest player and England captain, the first £100 a week player. Take a seat in the changing room, imagine you are playing in the match and listening to the Head Coach give a team talk. Take your place in the dugout and players tunnel and walk in the footsteps of George Cohen, the only English right-back to win the World Cup, back in 1966. The ground is traditional, historical and fascinating. Our tours are all led by an official guide who will be delighted to show you a truly special, famous and iconic ground. We cannot wait to show you around. Come on Fulham!
address: Craven Cottage Stevenage Road, London SW6 6HH England

top_reviews.title: Loved Craven Cottage. Love from India🇮🇳
top_reviews.review: Visiting London for the first time and Craven Cottage was first on my itinerary and I enjoyed it very much. Our guide was Ed and he explained everything so we'll and was very warm. Must visit! Thank you Ed.

top_reviews.title: Craven Cottage tour
top_reviews.review: Excellent tour with Will and Joe who were both very friendly and knowledgeable. Visited on 10th October 2023, 127 years to the day when the first game was played at this ground . Visited all areas of the ground with the Johnny Haines stand and The Cottage being the highlights. Plenty of photo opportunities at this historic football ground , highly recommend the tour . Good luck Fulham , except when you play the Bluebirds ! ( which may not be for a while ! )

top_reviews.title: A visit to the home of football.
top_reviews.review: After a short walk through Bishop's Park we arrived at Craven Cottage right alongside the wonderful statue of Johnny Haynes, where the tour started once we had signed in at the reception. We were introduced to our Tour Guides, Will and Joey, who led us into the ground to start the tour. We were privileged to be there on October 10th as it was 127 years to the day that Fulham played their first match on this ground. (We were all given a small memento of the occasion). First we were given a demonstration of how small the turnstiles are as this part of the ground is a Grade 1 Listed Building and no alterations can be made. From there we were guided through the Johnny Haynes Stand with it's wooden seats well over 100 years old. As a lifelong Fulham supporter my dream was always one day to go inside the "Cottage" well today we did. We ascended the steps into the lounge and then out onto the balcony of the Cottage. To see the ground from there was breathtaking, a dream come true. Thinking about all the countless footballers and celebrities who have stood there over the past 100 or more years was just amazing. We then visited the dressing rooms where in the "home" dressing room the shirts of the current first team squad are hanging on hooks ready for the next game. We saw the physio room and the small gym. The "away" dressing room was not quite so plush, but then why would it be? We then walked through the tunnel onto the pitch area, although we obviously were not allowed to walk on the hallowed turf. Then it was over to the new stand, which is reputed to be costing Fulham Chairman, Shahid Khan, £120m and season tickets will be £3,000 a time which is the highest in the Football League. However, if you want to watch the "best" you have to pay for it. Then it was back through the "Hammy" end to the Trophy Room. Not many trophies in there but who needs trophies when the enjoyment is in watching Fulham. Then it was through the club shop and the tour was over. Will gave us a wonderful guided tour telling us many bits of information about players and matches over the years and all aspects of the ground itself. The whole tour was at our pace, (I am in my 80s and I have difficulties walking) and we were encouraged to ask as many questions and take as many photos we wanted. The tour took well over an hour. It was a wonderful experience and we were all made to feel special. It is well worth a visit even if you aren't a Fulham supporter. Thank you Fulham FC for the wonderful time we all had.

top_reviews.title: Memorable Experience
top_reviews.review: We booked The Craven Cottage tour as a surprise for my Dad’s 60th birthday present. Doug was our tour guide alongside Julie and another young guy (so sorry can’t remember his name!) Doug knew his knowledge about the ground and can tell they were passionate about the club. From the moment we got there to the time we left the stadium, the experience was incredible, they couldn’t have been more accommodating. Especially as we had our three year old son, and 8 month old daughter. Who may I add being football mad he enjoyed it so much, they even let him lead his own team out into the pitch, what a moment for him! We could take all the photos we wanted too. The stadium itself is just full of historic stories, the grade listed buildings is what makes fulham so unique and is worth a visit! To make the tour personalised for my dads birthday, they even organised a signed birthday card from the players and placed it into the changing room - such a special touch. Thank you Tour Team, you definitely made it a memorable experience for us all. ⚽️🤍🖤

top_reviews.title: Brilliant Tour
top_reviews.review: Fantastic trip to this beautiful football club by the Thames for my birthday. Ian the host was very knowledgeable and also provided plenty of light humour which made the visit interesting and informative. As a lifelong Fulham fan even I learnt something new about my beloved Football Club so it’s a must for any Fulham fan or even someone visiting London and wanting to visit a proper Football ground which has a bit of history.

top_reviews.title: Amazing stadium tour
top_reviews.review: I mean as a Fulham fan I'm trying to not be biased, but the stadium tour was amazing. I highly recommend it to any football fan. Our tour guide Julie was really informative, friendly and helpful, as was Joey. The tour is full of history and I learnt a lot about the club that I never knew before. It's really great value for money too. I can't recommend it more highly!

top_reviews.title: Brasileiro em Craven Cottage
top_reviews.review: Good morning! on Saturday I visited Craven Cottage, I was accompanied by Julie. I’m Brazilian, I’m a Fulham fan! I want to thank you for the fantastic experience, I want to thank Fulham and I want to especially thank Julie for accompanying me and translating what the guide said, helping me to better live the experience of being Fulham!!!!!

top_reviews.title: Must Do in Fulham
top_reviews.review: Ian our guide was amazing with his knowledge of the club and grounds. He provided excellent overview of the history behind the club, his passion for the club was obvious. Was inviting, accessible and a good memory as he recalled to us during a conversation about the weather that us from Calgary would know cold weather. The tour was well paced and the opportunity for photos was ever present. Strongly recommend to all to take this tour and support the small club that can. Thank you Ian.

top_reviews.title: great from start to finish
top_reviews.review: From booking the tour with Ed to going round the stadium with Mark and Joey this was a really friendly, enjoyable and professional experience. Whether Fulham is your team or not, getting to see the history of this ground mixed with the brand new impressive expansion is really great. Everyone there is chatty and helpful, they care a lot about the team and ground and gear the tour according to the interests of the people visiting. We took my dad for his birthday as he is a long term Fulham fan and he was delighted with the gift and getting to talk about old players and managers. The knowledge of the staff was excellent and the whole thing was very 'Fulhamish' and educational.

top_reviews.title: Fantastic!
top_reviews.review: The tour was awesome! Unfortunately I was not in London long enough to see any games so I figured I’d come tour the grounds and I was not disappointed. The tour guides Judy and Phillip were extremely personable and knowledgeable. We went through every part of the stadium and had the chance to take a bunch of pictures. Definitely would recommend if you’re a fulham fan!

name: Theatre Royal Drury Lane
description: An all-day destination for entertainment, afternoon tea, dining, drinking, art & culture, in the heart of Covent Garden and London's West End. In 2019, LW Theatres embarked on £60 million project to restore the historic Grade 1 listed Theatre Royal Drury Lane to its former 1812 glory. Now open all day to the public, the newly restored Theatre Royal Drury Lane, affectionately known as The Lane, is reimagined as a new destination for entertainment, food, bars, art and culture, so the iconic interiors can be enjoyed by everyone not just theatregoers. Discover more about Theatre Royal Drury Lane.
address: Catherine Street, London WC2B 5JF England

top_reviews.title: Great experience for afternoon tea
top_reviews.review: Everything was delicious! Tea was good quality and the ambiance was very nice. Very fun outing for our family visiting for our first every afternoon tea experience. Service was very attentive waitress even took photos of my family for us

top_reviews.title: Frozen was a great show and the theatre was stunning
top_reviews.review: This theatre is stunning especially inside I've been to a few theatres in London and this one is definitely the fanciest. We came for frozen and all the staff were really friendly and helpful especially when I got lost looking for the loo The show itself was great we had stall seats A25& 26 and they were a great view the seats were comfortable and plenty of legroom. Id love to come back and do one of the day time tours they offer

top_reviews.title: Great Afternoon Tea in such a Historic Building
top_reviews.review: Lovely tea experience! Stopped for afternoon tea after taking a tour of the theatre. The tea and assorted food was delicious and the atmosphere very relaxing. Was a delightful way to absorb all of the history I had just learned! Would recommend and will likely be back.

top_reviews.title: A Superb Tour of The Theatre Royal
top_reviews.review: What a wonderful way to spend an afternoon in London! My sister and I were lucky enough to have Victoria as our guide on this sensational theatre tour. Victoria, an actress and a warm and consummate communicator, took us expertly through the history of this extraordinarily beautiful theatre and interspersed our tour with fun anecdotes. She led us both on a grand tour of the auditorium and staircases of The Theatre Royal and to otherwise unseen areas - it all felt such a privilege. Thank you, Victoria. I shall pass the word on to friends and family regarding this fabulous tour. I believe young and old would love it! 😊

top_reviews.title: Frozen musical
top_reviews.review: This was my first time visiting this theatre and I have to say it was stunning inside. I came with my 4 year old daughter to see Frozen the musical and everyone we spoke to from the security on the door, to the bar staff, to the ushers were so friendly and made the experience truly wonderful. My only gripe was that considering I paid £190 for 2 tickets I spent most of the show staring at the back of another guests head. I know this isn’t the theatres fault and they can’t control who would be sitting in front of me but £190 is a lot of money to pay to spend the performance leaning over to one side so I could see the stage properly. The chairs were slanted slightly, but only slightly. Which is a shame when ticket prices are so much money. Frozen itself was every bit as magical as we thought it would be and I would recommend to any little Elsa fans.

top_reviews.title: Afternoon Tea for Birthday Celebration!
top_reviews.review: We had the most lovely time at afternoon tea to celebrate my birthday. Not only was the food, service, and tea excellent, but I was fortunate enough to be serenaded by Emily. She has one of the most beautiful voices we have ever heard, and it was one of the most special experiences. Thank you, all!

top_reviews.title: Fabulous guided tour!
top_reviews.review: Prompt start. James and Lyn (tour guides) are FANTASTIC! Tour is well organised and both guides are very knowledgeable with the T/Royal history. Tour lasts about 1.5hrs and it is totally worth it! I have already recommended the tour to several friends (of all ages from teens to more mature ages). You will not be disappointed.

top_reviews.title: Theatre Royal Drury Lane tour
top_reviews.review: On a visit to London we decided to do the Theatre Royal Drury Lane tour. They go 2 a day and we picked the 10:30am tour. We were welcomed warmly and directed to a a seating area to await the start of the tour. We were lucky enough to be the only people booked on the tour, which was fantastic. The theatre has been recently renovated, to a very high standard. We were taken around by the fabulous David who told tales and provided facts. It was so interesting. We visited the Royal room and sat on the sofa that the Royal family use when they visit the theatre. We went in the auditorium, down in the tunnels under the theatre. David told us historical facts and ghost stories. The room where afternoon tea is served is lovely, next time we'll book that. I would highly recommend this as a must do if you love theatres

top_reviews.title: Happy Visually Impaired Customer
top_reviews.review: I just wanted to dedicate this review not to a particular show, but rather to the exceptional level of customer service given to us (me and my mum). Being visually impaired and my mum being my carer, the staff were extremely friendly right from the beginning, starting from the security, then the member of staff that checked our tickets - she even went that extra mile to walk us all the way to our seats, and then during the intermission; another member of staff came to see if we were alright, which was really nice, and then finally, at the end of the show, another member of staff helped us to leave via a special exit door. So we were very impressed with overall, Superb customer service. Thank you very much indeed.👨🏽‍🦯

top_reviews.title: Delightful Afternoon Tea treat
top_reviews.review: Wonderful afternoon tea experience in the Grand Saloon. Lovely staff including one who kindly told us which was the best tube station to get and the extremely talented Maitre d’ who serenaded the birthday girl in our group and bought an extra cake. We loved that there were no sandwiches, I can make them at home, the food was fun and different and ample for us, the champagne delicious, a wonderful treat well done team.

name: Kensington Gardens
description: Separated from Hyde Park by the Serpentine, a lake used by boaters and swimmers, this park is calmer and more peaceful than its neighbor, and features many attractions including a statue of Peter Pan, Albert Memorial and the Serpentine Art Gallery.
address: The Magazine Storeyard, London W2 UH England

top_reviews.title: A lovely place to visit
top_reviews.review: Yesterday we were taken to the gardens by a friend who lives nearby, it was good to be given a sort of walking tour around the area . Plenty to see, lovely well maintained place . The sunken garden beside the palace is very beautiful and made very special with the Princess Diana Statue. Lovely place to spend time for a bit of peace and quiet to enjoy nature in the busy city

top_reviews.title: Awesome Park
top_reviews.review: Kensington Gardens is one the most beautiful places that walked through. It's located west of Hyde Park, Kensington is made up of many amazing smaller gardens, statutes, and man made ponds, that are connected many paths. Inside of Kensington Gardens you can find, Kensington Palace, where some the royals live, the Italian Gardens, Diana Memorial Playground, and Albertopolis, so wear comfy shoes, there will be a lot of walking. This is a great place to relax, exercise, walk, meet, gaze, and enjoy the way, it really insulates you from the hectic London streets.

top_reviews.title: New item - toad in the hole
top_reviews.review: Today ordered Toad in the hole with mashed potatoes, vegetables and gravy. Followed by coffee cake and tea. New item on the menu cooked just like my grandmother used to make. Mince and onion pie and steak and ale pie just some of the other meals eaten at this local friendly cafe. Five stars all round😋

top_reviews.title: Oasis in London
top_reviews.review: Late autumn and the variety of colours of the leaves still clinging to the trees is beautiful. Away from the hustle and bustle of the noise of the city you really can stand and stare beneath the boughs. There are even squirrels to watch as they busy themselves about. The Serpentine is a lovely space to walk around and see the glint of the low autumn sun imagining you are in the middle of the countryside. It’s a lovely place with so much to take in and so many changes to witness through the seasons.

top_reviews.title: Bird watcher paradise
top_reviews.review: What lovely gardens to have a picnic, walk about, and read a book by a shade tree. If you love birds like myself, this place is even more adorable. There are tons of swans, and other birds. You can just sit there and birdwatch for hours and watch as the swans preen themselves. I had a great time in these gardens and the decor is so beautiful. It was really close to our hotel so it was a great walk for us.

top_reviews.title: How I Enjoy The Gardens of London in Winter
top_reviews.review: Good walking shoes are a must, or rain boots that are comfortable, or hiking books that are great for walking more than hiking. Expect rain and puddles everywhere, especially in the winter months, so you want shoes that are water resistant or waterproof. Do not feed the wildlife please, you will see signs asking you to obey this rule, but as always, humans do what they want to do and have no respect for nature or rules. Do not touch the flowers or plants in the gardens! I know you are tempted to take a flower, and yes they are beautiful, but leave the gardens as you find them. The gardens can be windy and cold, especially in the areas that are close to the river, you will need to wear something warm, and again, it might also be raining! You need a good umbrella, your hotel will probably have some, mine did and they were of excellent quality. This is not a city for low grade umbrellas guys, you gotta step up your game! Stay off that luscious green grass, I know it’s tempting, but your feet will be covered in mud and dog poop. If you look around in any direction you will notice dog trainers in the grass, and with the weather you already know it’s wet! Stay off the grass and let the dogs enjoy a bit of room to play! Make room for those getting a bit of exercise, there will be walkers, joggers and runners of all types, let them pass in peace please! Don’t miss the artwork and its detailed explanation by the artist. This is The Arch by Henry Moore, his sculptures are loved around the world. Stop and read Discover the Birds of The Longwater! You will find some interesting tidbits about the different variations of birds and what makes them unique! This is a great place for a date, the entry is free, you can spend time walking and roaming and find a cafe for a light low cost snack and of course, a spot of tea. A picnic alone or with friends would also work, I would not advise that during the winter, but in the spring and summer, I know these grounds are packed with people of all ages enjoying the beauty in the company of others. Peter Pan~The boy who would not grow up! If you are a fan of Peter Pan, don’t miss the statue, and expect people to be there getting selfies and refusing to move so you can enjoy the spot as well. Pay them no mind, especially if you aren’t in a rush! Make sure you visit one of the cafes or gift shops, a portion of the proceeds from all purchases support the upkeep of the parks and wildlife! A rule to follow in all nature spaces is take nothing, and leave with what you came with, trash included! I can say these grounds, trails and paths were in immaculate condition. Aside from people feeding the birds, I saw no trash and no rules being broken. So take a day to roam around Hyde Park, there is beauty that is there for everyone of all ages and interests to enjoy! Unnerved Traveler

top_reviews.title: Pretty garden
top_reviews.review: We had a wander through here in the early evening and found it very clean and peaceful even though it was quite busy. It is well looked after and has plenty of space an the lake was filled with swans and many ducks. It was nice to have a stroll in the sun.

top_reviews.title: Beautiful and free :)
top_reviews.review: We are so lucky in Britain to have so much green space and this park is no exception. The gardens are lovely to walk around and so much to see. There is the sunken garden behind Kensington Palace where you can gaze upon the statue unveiled a few years ago of Princess Diana. There is also a lake and various walks through the park. It is abundant with wildlife and birds including parakeets. Lovely to just walk around and take everything in.

top_reviews.title: Lovely Sunday Walk In Kensington Gardens
top_reviews.review: Ate a picnic lunch by the Elfin Oak Tree. We saw Diana’s Memorial Garden, Kensington Castle, Peter Pan, the Albert Memorial and a Terrier Statue. We tried to see more of the statues but this park is huge! Wear good walking shoes and bring water. The signage could have been better. Also, the restrooms we found were closed.

top_reviews.title: Oasis in the City
top_reviews.review: Kensington Gardens is a serene and beautiful spot. We enjoyed wandering through the gardens, with highlights including the stunning Italian Gardens, the Peter Pan statue, and the beautiful Kensington Palace. The park is less crowded than Hyde Park, making it a perfect place for a peaceful stroll. The well-kept lawns and colorful flowerbeds add to its charm. A must-visit for anyone looking to unwind and enjoy nature in the heart of London.

name: The All England Lawn Tennis Club
breadcrumbs: The All England Lawn Tennis Club
address: Church Road Wimbledon, London SW19 5AE England

top_reviews.title: Good visit.
top_reviews.review: Had tickets for court one this time and the view from the back row was still very good. The whole venue was very clean and getting into the venue was very well organised. Big quese for drinks etc as expected but did not take too long. Only thing is the wifi signal does not work inside the court at the back so i would recommend they install signal boosters.

top_reviews.title: Amazing day out!
top_reviews.review: We had a phenomenal day out on the last Saturday of the Wimbledon championship. The whole venue is pristine - full of greenery and well kept flowers - and jam packed with food and beverage outlets and retail shops. The ticket price is well worth it and there were a huge number of matches for us to choose from, including access to Court One with our ticket from the ballot.

top_reviews.title: Very impressive
top_reviews.review: I had tickets for the men’s semi finals on Centre Court, which was amazing but the whole complex is impressive. As you walk in the outer courts are ahead of you and everything is done to perfection. Plenty of toilets and food and drink outlets. It is expensive, but it’s the home of one of the most prestigious tennis competitions in the world and there is money about. Worth a visit even when the competition isn’t on. Very impressive.

name: National Gallery
description: The National Gallery houses the national collection of paintings in the Western European tradition from the 13th to the 19th centuries. It is on show 361 days a year, free of charge.
address: Trafalgar Square, London WC2N 5DN England

top_reviews.title: Simply wonderful
top_reviews.review: Not much I can add about this magnificent building and incredible collection of works. I was happy to book a free ticket and make a donation (suggested). Great value, as I didn't feel the need for a guide. Plenty of group, and self-directed options, if you would prefer one. Fantastic day out.

top_reviews.title: Great museum
top_reviews.review: We reserved these tickets online during our layover, and they were Free, requiring only advance booking. Exploring the plethora of exquisite paintings and artworks was a delightful experience. Although art isn't my particular passion, I found it enjoyable. The gallery is conveniently situated in the downtown area, near Westminster station and other notable landmarks. If you happen to be in London without any prior engagements, I highly recommend visiting this cultural gem.
The gallery is truly a must see in London! with some of the most beautiful art work. Book your free ticket online and skip the line up :) The amazing staff make your time even more enjoyeble.

top_reviews.title: Awesome, and free
top_reviews.review: TIPS: As with all great museums, do some planning beforehand and decide what it is that you want to see. Then go early before the crowds and, for this gallery, do book - its free and you can book even a few minutes before entry. Booking allows you to go to the front of the queue. Enjoy !

top_reviews.title: National treasure
top_reviews.review: Fantastic to see such famous works of art up close. The gallery is free and realy relaxed which is amazing considering the value of the priceless works of art. Staff were friendly and made you welcome. This gallery is a national treasure please keep up the good work

top_reviews.title: Art lovers unite here!
top_reviews.review: Enjoyable museum and you can't beat the price. It's free! Quite a few masterpieces including da Vinci's The Burlington House Cartoon and The Virgin of the Rocks. There are also plenty of Impressionists if that's your preference; Cezanne, Picasso, and van Gogh. A great way to spend a few hours to get cultured and inspired so get there early! It gets crowded fast!

top_reviews.title: Definitely go if you want to see some art!
top_reviews.review: Free admission to this beautiful gallery. Absolutely loved going in, wish I had more time to see the whole thing. If you're an art lover/want to see some iconic works, go visit. Loved the Impressionism and Pointlism pieces the most.

top_reviews.title: 3 Hours and you are done
top_reviews.review: Any museum of this scope and magnitude can be a challenge. Museum Fatigue will set in after about three hours of exploration. You'll know that you are ready to leave when you walk by one-of-a-kind / priceless / unique archeological finds and don't even notice them. That is when you decide to come back another day and go have a nice pint somewhere else :)

top_reviews.title: Just get lost in it
top_reviews.review: This is such an amazing space to get lost in. It's bright but with a very relaxing atmosphere. Plenty of places to sit in and take in the miriad of art to view. I cannot believe that this is free (even making the suggested donation doesn't feel enough). Definitely somewhere to visit time and time again.

top_reviews.title: A must for art lovers
top_reviews.review: This gallery is a must for anyone who appreciates art, as it contains some of the world's greatest paintings (from Van Gogh to William Turner to Rembrandt to Monet). You could literally spend hours just roaming the halls with Impressionists, let alone the rest of the 2,600+ strong collection of works. PSA: It is strongly advised to book ahead of time as - especially during the holiday season - it can get busy and you might not find a slot that fits your schedule. It is free to visit, donation is optional. Finally, while you are at it, you might want to consider a visit to the adjacent National Portrait Gallery (same building, separate entrance and ticketing system).

name: Up at The O2
description: Get ready for a breathtaking new attraction, combining an exhilarating active outdoor challenge with a completely unique perspective on the Capital.Prepare yourself for an unforgettable 90 minute experience which will take you on an uplifting expedition across the roof of the world's most popular entertainment venue. Enjoy spectacular 360 degree views of London from our viewing platform in the centre of the roof, before finishing with a thrilling descent back to base to complete your adventure.
address: The O2, London SE10 0DX England

top_reviews.title: Fantastic birthday experience with a glass of bubbly 🥂
top_reviews.review: Had a great time UP the 02, Freya took us through the training and guided the tour, she really knew her stuff and made us laugh the whole time too. We organised the excursion for our Dad’s birthday and it exceeded expectations! Freya even poured us a glass of bubbly at the top of the 02 to top things off :)

top_reviews.title: Another item ticked off the bucket list
top_reviews.review: All the staff on the ground were very friendly. Jabed, our guide was great it was very professional and felt safe all the way across, and a great view from the top it is definitely a must-see attraction. You can order drinks for the top as well

top_reviews.title: Great experience - must do!
top_reviews.review: Fantastic experience! The whole process from arrival until exiting is very professional. Joey, our guide was great, a real asset to your team. He explained everything with real passion and knowledge, he engaged with the whole group really well and clear loves his job. Was nervous booking because of the time of year so lucked out with the weather being dry and sunny albeit windy. Great experience, well done everyone involved

top_reviews.title: Fun experience.
top_reviews.review: We had booked the 11:30 am slot on our daughter's birthday which fell on a Saturday. The weather showed clear skies when I booked a few weeks ahead, but that morning it was rainy, windy and cold. I really thought we had messed up our girl's big day, but thankfully just as we were all kitted up to start climbing, everything cleared up and the sun shone brightly down upon us. We could see all the landmarks from the observation deck on the top of the O2. The climb itself was easy though it is a little stressful in the ankles when you are doing the steepest ascent (30°). The descent is much simpler. The whole experience takes about 1.5 hours from registering to visiting the gift shop to collect your photos (includes a briefing session, getting kitted up and photos). This is a good activity for a day out in London.

top_reviews.title: Absolutely incredible day out!
top_reviews.review: The climb seemed daunting at first but was definitely worth it for the incredible view of London. Our guide Johnny was amazing; friendly, chatty and enthusiastic throughout the whole climb, and was always checking in on each of us. He was also very knowledgeable about the sights of London at the top of the O2, and took many photos for us which was an added bonus. Thank you Johnny!

top_reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant
top_reviews.review: We did this today at 4:30pm so we got to see London at night. Our guide was lovely and very kind with advice as I was worried about the strain on my knees on the decent. He advised me to go backwards which made perfect sense. The view from the top is spectacular and we thoroughly enjoyed our experience.

top_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
top_reviews.review: Would 100% a climb up at the O2 the staff were very friendly and accommodating especially as we were running late thanks to lots of underground closures. They were very understanding and put us at ease. The climb was lots of fun and the instructors are all an asset to the company. Freya on our climb was brilliant and had us smiling.

top_reviews.title: Exhilarating London climb
top_reviews.review: We had a great time climbing over the o2. It was a beautiful sunny morning to see all the sights. Our guide Scarlet was fantastic, she was knowledgable and had an infectious enthusiastic personality ensuring we had fun all the way. It is very well organised activity, and we had the opportunity to borrow jackets, shoes and gloves. We definitely needed the shoes as it was slippery on the way down. I would highly recommend this for a fun 90 minutes in East London.

top_reviews.title: Brilliant experience
top_reviews.review: Fantastic attraction, so pleased we did it. Weather great & although rather windy it didn't spoil the experience. Max our guide was a great laugh, he provided so much information & was very knowledgeable on the the area. Thanks 😊

top_reviews.title: Great family fun
top_reviews.review: When my son said he wanted to climb the O2 my heart sank! I am absolutely petrified of heights but here I found myself! Let me tell you I am so pleased I did this with him. It was superb.... a great thing to do. Joey, our guide was brilliant. Highly recommend. Good value, very professional, fabulous staff. A firm 10 out of 10 from us.

name: Hunterian Museum
address: 38–43 Lincolns Inn Fields Royal College Of Surgeons Of England, London WC2A 3PE England

top_reviews.title: Amazing Museum
top_reviews.review: Loved this museum. Might be a little odd to some but its full of amazing facts & details about surgery over the years. Things that were done to progress us to basically where we are today. Thousands of exhibits and a fantastic place to walk around.

top_reviews.title: An amazing museum
top_reviews.review: My eldest daughter and I visited the museum back in April after having a cheeky Nando’s first. We spent a good two hours in there and the time flew by, it is an amazing piece of history, the collections are truly incredible. 100% worth a visit and it was free entry.

top_reviews.title: Very interesting
top_reviews.review: Interesting. Practically, you can follow the development of surgery in its early stages, the effects of venereal diseases (which had no effective treatment in those days) on the bone system and many more. Also, there are dozens/hundreds of naturalized, dissected animals, presented in various stages of their development. Entry is free.

top_reviews.title: Fascinating
top_reviews.review: Really interesting museum, excellently curated. It's well run, and full of fascinating exhibits about the history of surgery, animal/human specimens and diseases. It wouldn't be for everyone but there are plenty of warnings about what you might see before you enter and rules of conduct.

top_reviews.title: Very interesting
top_reviews.review: Amazing site. If you are not interested in the workings of living things, then definitely do not go there! It's amazing to see so many exhibits that have been gathered throughout time. Even some displays related to contemporary medicine. Very knowledgeable volunteers in medicine also contributed to the success of the project. The free admission was well worth it.

top_reviews.title: Fascinating!
top_reviews.review: Fascinating and informative, this museum is crammed with biological specimens, including human, and historical medical history. It is definitely not for the squeamish and very young children. Many older children will love it though. Entry is limited so you should book timed tickets (free!) online before going to avoid waiting around. The staff couldn't have been more kind and friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. There is so much to see that I'll definitely go back again

top_reviews.title: A must-see for all biologists!
top_reviews.review: As a biologist and zoologist, the Hunterian Museum has been somewhere I have wanted to visit since I discovered it’s existence. You need to have a strong stomach to visit (due to the large number of human remains on display), but it it worth it. I will certainly be visiting again next time I am in London!

top_reviews.title: Extremely interesting Museum! A must!
top_reviews.review: Extremely interesting displays of specimens, both animal and human. Not a huge collection but could still spend 1-2 hours reading everything. Easy to get to and a must for any visitors to London, one of the best museums I have been to. Highly recommend

name: Camden Market
description: We're driven by the belief that you can only keep discovering if you keep looking ... so we're always adding interesting stores and traders. No two days are ever the same at Camden Market. Keep checking back to see what's new and what's next.
address: Camden Lock Place, London NW1 8AF England

top_reviews.title: Don’t rush
top_reviews.review: The markets are much smaller these days, yet still jam packed with thousands of unique items & gifts. Spend hours wandering around the small pathways, get lost amongst the stalls, find that item you didn't even know you needed. Grab a coffee from the Stables cafe. Most stalls do not allow photos unfortunately.

top_reviews.title: The market as well as the surrounding area were very crowded
top_reviews.review: We visited Camden Market on a Saturday morning. The market as well as the surrounding area were very crowded, both with locals and tourists. There were many stalls selling food, clothing, records and CDs, etc. The food that we bought were actually very good.

top_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
top_reviews.review: Definitely worth visiting if your in London, the market is fabulous to walk around. However the food is just unbelievable and worth visiting only for the food. I would advise getting their before opening 10:30 ish to avoid the busy crowds we did this and didn’t have to wait for food once the stores opened at 11:00 ( we visited on a Sunday). Would highly recommend planing a visit here in to your London weekend.

top_reviews.title: SwankyWineWorld
top_reviews.review: Loved it. Freddy the owner of SwankyWineWorld was fantastic. Very engaging and jocular. Happy to purchase a wine bottle containing corkacrew, foil cutter, drip collar, pourer, bottle stopper. Very well presented for £15. Bargain. I'll be back from Birmingham some time soon.

top_reviews.title: great for a nice stroll and very scenic
top_reviews.review: camden market and the way to it from the trainstation were very pleasant, we met nice people, the street artist were nice and one could bargain on nice clothes and shoes. the prices were great, nothing too expensive compared to the other food markets one can go to. there is something for everyone. the polish sausage is a must!

top_reviews.title: Good day out!
top_reviews.review: Camden market has a buzzing atmosphere. It’s a maze of vintage shops, leather goods, accessories, books, record shops, toys and food kiosks all situated in old stables. Here you will also find the Amy Winehouse Statue which I’m a big fan of and took multiple photos.
